abstract.p: New York Islanders preseason schedule listed (S)

block.p: For the first time since 1997, the Islanders will face the Rangers in a preseason game, scheduled to be played in Hartford on Oct. 1.

The Islanders will open their preseason on Sept. 14-15 with back-to-back games against the Flyers at Trenton and Philadelphia, then face the Stanley Cup champion Devils at the Nassau Coliseum on Sept. 20 in their lone home exhibition.
For the first time since 1997, the Islanders will face the Rangers in a preseason game, scheduled to be played in Hartford on Oct. 1.

The Islanders will open their preseason on Sept. 14-15 with back-to-back games against the Flyers at Trenton and Philadelphia, then face the Stanley Cup champion Devils at the Nassau Coliseum on Sept. 20 in their lone home exhibition.
They also play the Washington Capitals at Richmond on Sept. 23 and conclude the preseason at New Jersey on Oct. 2.

Every one of the six games is against one of our top rivals, so that should bring the emotion out, Coach Butch Goring said. I also like the breakdown of two games a week. That way we can have several practices in a row, see how we do in games and then get back to work at practice.
